TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCReverseTime extends Cocos2D.CCActionInterval

Docs.summary: Executes an action in reverse order, from time=duration to time=0.
Docs.remarks: <para> <para>Use this action carefully. This action is not sequenceable. Use it as the default "reversed" method of your own actions, but using it outside the "reversed" scope is not recommended. </para> </para><para>Use this action carefully. This action is not sequenceable. Use it as the default "reversed" method of your own actions, but using it outside the "reversed" scope is not recommended. </para><para>Use this action carefully. This action is not sequenceable. Use it as the default "reversed" method of your own actions, but using it outside the "reversed" scope is not recommended. </para>

Docs.summary: returns a new action that performs the exactly the reverse action
Docs.remarks: returns a new action that performs the exactly the reverse action

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void StartWithTarget(class Cocos2D.CCNode target) cil managed

Docs.summary: called before the action start. It will also set the target.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Stop() cil managed

Docs.summary: called after the action has finished. It will set the 'target' to nil. IMPORTANT: You should never call "[action stop]" manually. Instead, use: "target->stopAction(action);"
Docs.remarks: called after the action has finished. It will set the 'target' to nil. IMPORTANT: You should never call "[action stop]" manually. Instead, use: "target->stopAction(action);"

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Update(float32 time) cil managed

Docs.summary: called once per frame. time a value between 0 and 1
Docs.remarks: <para>called once per frame. time a value between 0 and 1</para><para>For example:<list type="bullet"><item><description>0 means that the action just started</description></item><item><description>0.5 means that the action is in the middle</description></item><item><description>1 means that the action is over </description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>0 means that the action just started</description> </item> <item> <description>0.5 means that the action is in the middle</description> </item> <item> <description>1 means that the action is over </description> </item> </list><para>0 means that the action just started</para><para>0.5 means that the action is in the middle</para><para>1 means that the action is over </para>
